meanings.definition: To strike with a sharp blow or slap.
meanings.sent1: He smacked the ball with his bat.
meanings.sent2: She smacked the mosquito on her arm.
meanings.sent3: The chef smacked the dough to flatten it.
meanings.sent4: The waves smacked against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher smacked the ruler on the desk to get the students' attention.

meanings.definition: To have a taste or smell of something.
meanings.sent1: The soup smacked of garlic and herbs.
meanings.sent2: The air smacked of salt from the ocean.
meanings.sent3: Her cooking always smacked of home.
meanings.sent4: The coffee smacked of bitterness and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The pie smacked of cinnamon and apples, making it irresistible.

meanings.definition: To be under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
meanings.sent1: He smacked after drinking too much at the party.
meanings.sent2: She smacked and couldn't walk straight.
meanings.sent3: The catnip made the cat smacked and sleepy.
meanings.sent4: The medication made him feel smacked and drowsy.
meanings.sent5: The group of friends were all smacked and giggly after taking the pills.
